page.title: 05Communications in Laindon
page.content: The area is divided by the A127 London to Southend road which is a busy commuter and holiday route. This has been joined to Britain's motorway system 10 miles further west where it meets the M25. A new road, West Mayne, has been built to link the industrial estate to the A127. It is hoped to attract industry to Laindon to provide more employment. By contrast, the roads to the north of the A127 are country lanes serving the few farms to be found in this sector of the block. These minor roads are quite narrow and winding but they carry alot of traffic at peak times.
